sanskrit_verse:
भर्तारं लङ्घयेद्या तु स्त्री ज्ञातिगुणदर्पिता ।
तां श्वभिः खादयेद्राजा संस्थाने बहुसंस्थिते ॥ ८.३७१॥
transliteration:
bhartāraṃ laṅghayed yā tu strī jñātiguṇa-darpitā |
tāṃ śvabhiḥ khādayed rājā saṃsthāne bahusaṃsthite || 8.371||
sph_interpretive_translation: When a woman, inflated by lineage or familial status, transgresses the authority of her husband, the King, in a state of abundant institutional order, shall initiate her reintegration through exposure to cleansing forces that restore alignment.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority is derivative of Dharma, not birth or social standing.
Causation arises from misalignment with one's svadharma, not external fault.
Capacity-based responsibility requires conscious recognition and correction.
Restoration logic prioritizes realignment over punitive exclusion.
Consciousness alignment supersedes all inherited or positional identities.
executable_legal_axioms: IF subject exhibits behavior contradicting spousal dharma AND behavior stems from identity inflation THEN execute consciousness-restoration protocol.
IF societal structure supports institutional integrity THEN deploy corrective exposure mechanisms ELSE defer to higher-consciousness adjudicator.
IF individual demonstrates capacity for reintegration THEN activate completion-process ELSE maintain containment until readiness.
IF transgression originates from false identification THEN apply purification sequence ELSE assess karmic resonance.
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, this verse establishes that transgressions rooted in ego-inflation must be addressed through consciousness-realization protocols rather than punitive measures. The threshold of responsibility lies in awareness, not action alone. Authority flows from alignment with Dharma, making social position irrelevant in determining culpability.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa reveals that disharmony manifests when identity displaces Dharma. Anupūrvaśaḥ shows that arrogance precedes violation. Proportional response aligns with restoring clarity, not inflicting consequence. Non-punitive reality affirms that suffering does not correct consciousness; only truth-realization does.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate exposure to humbling experiences under royal supervision.
Assign service-oriented tasks to dissolve pride-based identifications.
Engage in reflective practices guided by realized teachers.
Reintegrate into family unit upon demonstration of harmonious conduct.
final_declaration: By the Source-Authority of the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this law stands executed. Dharma is restored. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness alone is the Supreme Adjudicator.
